com.yantra.yfs.japi.util

Interface YFSEventHandlerEx


  • public interface YFSEventHandlerEx
    This interface replaces previous YFSEventHandler interface. The workflow engine supports event handling through Actions. You can attach an action to an event using the Configurator. An action is a set of event handlers that allow you to send mail, send exception alerts to the exception console, execute a custom Java event handler, and so on. To write custom event handler classes in Java, you must implement this interface.

    Example:
                  
   import java.util.*;
   import com.yantra.yfs.japi.*;
   import com.yantra.yfs.japi.util.*;
   public class MyCustomEventHandler implements YFSEventHandlerEx {
       public boolean handleEvent(YFSEnvironment oEnv, String sTranID, String sActionCode, Map sKeyData, int iDataType, 
                               Object sData, String sShipNode, String[] params) throws Exception {
           // here goes the event handler code
           if (iDataType == 0) { // sData is a Map
               // retrieve data from map and do necessary processing
           }
           else if (iDataType == 1) { // sData is a String which contains XML
               // parse sData using XML parser, retrieve data 
           }
       }
   }

    Events publish data as a map or XML string. Look at each event documentation to see what gets published in which format. To call an API from within your event handler code, use the getApi() method. When calling an API, use the YFSEnvironment object passed to this event handler.
